SUPPLEMENTARY MEMORANDUM on NAEB-NETRC
Working Relationships unrelated to JCEB
NOTE: Harley, White, and Robertson agreed that the draft
proposal for submission at the February 2 meeting
of JCET ought to include only those areas of ac¬
tivity formerly the concerns of JCET, but that at
some time in the future — in discussion with their
I /own boards and staff and in some type Of joint an¬
nouncement — the following additional working
relationships should be identified. These can be
discussed in the February 2 meeting should this
be desirable.
The following items are numbered as though to
continue on after :he items included in the
draft proposal submitted to JCEB. /
To:
From:
Re;
VI. INTERNATIONAL EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTING
NAEB will have primary responsibility for international
exchange of consultants, overseas visits by educational broad¬
casters, and all international affairs not directly concerned
with broadcast programs and the planning, production, distri¬
bution, and transmission thereof.
NETRC, on the other hand, will have the primary res¬
ponsibility for international affairs which are directly concerned
with broadcast programs and the planning, production, distribution,
and transmission thereof.
VII. SUPPORTING SERVICES
As the recognized prSessional and trade organization in
